org.dellroad.stuff.vaadin22.field

Annotation Type AbstractFieldBuilder.EnabledBy


  • @Retention(value=RUNTIME)
 @Target(value=METHOD)
 @Documented
public static @interface AbstractFieldBuilder.EnabledBy
    Causes the generated field to be automatically enabled or disabled based on the value of some other field.

    Typically the other field is a Checkbox, but any type of field is supported. The target field will be enabled whenever the other field's value is not equal to its empty value.

    When the generated field is disabled, by default it is automatically reset to its empty value. To have it retain its previous value instead, so the value reappears if the checkbox is unchecked, set resetOnDisable() to false.

    If the named property does not exist in the Binder, or the target field's Component doesn't implement HasEnabled, then this annotation has no effect.

    Example: 

    
 public class GroceryItem {

     // Is this item perishable?
     @FieldBuilder.Checkbox(label = "Perishable food item")
     public boolean isPerishable() { ... }

     // This field is only used for perishable items
     @FieldBuilder.DatePicker
     @FieldBuilder.EnabledBy("perishable")
     @FieldBuilder.FormLayout("Expiration Date:")
     public LocalDate getExpirationDate() { ... }
 }
    See Also:
    @FieldBuilder.NullifyCheckbox

    • Required Element Summary

      Required Elements 
      Modifier and Type Required Element and Description
      String value
      The name of another property in the form that should control enablement.

    • Optional Element Summary

      Optional Elements 
      Modifier and Type Optional Element and Description
      boolean resetOnDisable
      Whether the value of this field should be automatically reset to its empty value when this field is disabled by its controlling field.

    • Element Detail

      • value

        public abstract String value
        The name of another property in the form that should control enablement.
        Returns:
        controlling property name

      • resetOnDisable

        public abstract boolean resetOnDisable
        Whether the value of this field should be automatically reset to its empty value when this field is disabled by its controlling field.
        Returns:
        whether to reset when disabled
        Default:
        true
